intro: Meconopsis lutescens, commonly known as the yellow meconopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. It has palmate leaves with a hairy texture and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
